citation.article-title: Revision of the taxonomic status of the species Rhizobium leguminosarum (Frank 1879) Frank 1889AL, Rhizobium phaseoli Dangeard 1926AL and Rhizobium trifolii Dangeard 1926AL. R. trifolii is a later synonym of R. leguminosarum. Reclassification of the strain R. leguminosarum DSM 30132 (=NCIMB 11478) as Rhizobium pisi sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Rhizobium phaseoli Dangeard 1926
Gram-negative rods as characteristic for the other species of the genus.
Colonies are small, pearl white coloured in YMA at 28 °C, the optimal growth temperature.
The optimum pH for growth is 7–7.5.
Growth occurs between 10 and 35 °C and at between pH 6 and 8.
Growth at pH 5 and in the presence of 1 % (w/v) NaCl is negative.
Positive for the production of β-galactosidase and urease and is able to hydrolyse aesculin in the API 20NE system.

Produces α- and β-arabinosidases, α- and β-glucosidases, α- and β-galactosidases, β-glucosaminidase, β-galactosaminidase, α-and β-fucosidases, α-and β-mannosidases, α- and β-xylosidases, rhamnosidase and acid and alkaline phosphatases using chromogenic paranitrophenyl substrates.
The production of β-cellobiase and lactosidase is weak and tests for the production of α- and β-maltosidases are negative using the same substrates.
The production of indole, arginine dehydrolase and gelatinase is negative in the API 20NE system.

Glucose, l-arabinose, fructose, galactose, l-rhamnose, xylose, melibiose, cellobiose, mannose, mannitol, sorbitol, inositol, xylitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, raffinose, sucrose, trehalose, salicin, l-histidine, aspartate, gluconate, glutamate, betaine and sarcosine are used as the sole carbon source, whereas l-sorbose, melezitose, erythritol, caproate, adipate, citrate, propionate, phenylacetate, l-serine, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-lysine and l-valine are not utilized as the sole carbon source.
Sensitive to ciprofloxacin, polymyxin B, oxytetracycline, cefuroxime and gentamicin.
Weakly sensitive to neomycin and erythromycin.
Resistant to ampicillin, penicillin and cloxacillin.
The type strain, ATCC 14482T (=DSM 30137T), was isolated from effective nodules of Phaseolus vulgaris and also nodulates Trifolium repens, but not Pisum sativum.
The G+C content of the type strain is 59.1 mol%.
